titles: The country-mans fare-vvel to London. Or, A broad-side against pride
publisher: Printed by A.P. for J. Conniers, at the sign of the Black-Raven in Duck-lane,
notes: Place and date of publication from Wing.
At end of text: With allowance.
Verse - "Let's stem the Tide, though vanity be grown,".
Reproduction of the originals in: British Library; William Andrews Clark Library.
keywords: Pride and vanity --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
